queryapp.forms module¶

Forms for the queryapp. Contains forms for queries and processing texts.

queryapp.models module¶

class queryapp.models.Text(id, name)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
textsalias_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

pizza.toppings and topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class queryapp.models.TextsAlias(id, identifier, processed)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

static for_texts(texts)¶
id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

identifier¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
processed¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

texts¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

pizza.toppings and topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

queryapp.tests module¶

queryapp.views module¶

Views for the queryapp. Responsible for handling all user interactions regarding queries.

queryapp.views.check_all_steps_task_status(request)¶

View to check the status of a task running on/with Celery. :param request: :return:

queryapp.views.get_provenance(request)¶

View to display the contents of a certain paragraph. Used by the Distant Reader to show previous or next paragraphs.

Parameters:request – A Django request object.
Returns:The contents of the selected (previous or next) paragraph in JSON format.
queryapp.views.load_and_prepare_provenance(tops, alias)¶

Loads provenances and generates a list of tuples of name, score and content of those provenances.

Parameters:
  • tops – The provenances/paragraphs being loaded.
  • alias – The Alias of the queried texts.
Returns:

A list of tuples of name, score and content of the provenances.
queryapp.views.markup_samples(samples, nodes)¶

Processes the content of the found provenances; emboldens words that appear in the graph.

Parameters:
  • samples – The provenances with their name, score and content.
  • nodes – The label/name of the nodes in the graph.
Returns:

A list containing tuples in the format (name, score, content, contained words) of the provenances.
queryapp.views.process(request)¶

View to process a text or multiple with the pipeline. Note that this can take very long to finish, depending on the total size of the text(s).

Parameters:request – A Django request object.
Returns:A rendered view showing the texts that were processed.
queryapp.views.query(request)¶

View for a simple user query.

Parameters:request – A Django request object.
Returns:A rendered page showing the result of the query.
